title: Error Prevention Strategies
content: Error prevention uses multiple strategies: elimination (remove error opportunity), substitution (less risky methods), engineering controls (physical barriers), administrative controls (procedures, training), and personal protective equipment. Higher-level controls are generally more effective.

scenario.story: Similar-looking valves have been confused in the past, causing incorrect operations. Management responds by: (A) adding labels, (B) additional training, (C) reminders to be careful, (D) physically redesigning handles to be distinguishable by touch.

options.C: Physical redesign most effectively prevents confusion errors

scenario.explanation: Physical redesign (engineering control) prevents the error regardless of attention, training, or label reading. Labels can be missed; training degrades; reminders are ignored under pressure. Engineering solutions that eliminate error opportunity are most robust.
